title: Bar and bat mitzvah
summary: The terms bar mitzvah (Hebrew: בַּר מִצְוָה‎) and bat mitzvah (Hebrew: בַּת מִצְוָה‎; Ashkenazi pronunciation: "bas mitzveh") refer to the coming-of-age ritual in Judaism; "bar" is used for a boy, while "bat" is used for a girl. In plural terms, "b'nei mitzvah" is used for both boys and mixed sex groups, while "b'not mitzvah" (Ashkenazi pronunciation: "b'nos mitzvah") is used for girls.
